Description: Rim and body sherd of Attic black-glazed pottery cup (type C); gently concave lip with sharp incurve offset the rim; glazed all over, misfired on the exterior. Graffito on the exterior.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 706, no. 647)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1657)
Höckmann & Möller 2006 / The Hellenion at Naukratis: Questions and Observations (p.19, no, 17)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
